alert.note: Alert for Chattahoochee; Marion; Stewart; Sumter; Webster (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 8:03PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Marion, southeastern Chattahoochee, Stewart, Webster and southwestern Sumter Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 803 PM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near Preston to near Sanford, and moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Lumpkin, Preston, Richland, Plains, Weston, Sumter, Seminole, Charles, Kimbrough, Westville, Croxton Crossroads, Brooklyn, Renfroe, Leveretts, Troutman, Omaha, Sanford, Maddox, Church Hill, and Centerpoint. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
